isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT - 1992-1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING - LOW COOLANT SWITCH

svcsubproc.para: First check for proper coolant levels. If coolant levels are not low, this test would be performed in response to the following occurrences:

step1.para: Cummins fault code 235, which would illuminate the Oil/Water warning lamp.
Cummins fault code 422, which would illuminate the YELLOW engine warning lamp. For complete fault code information refer to the appropriate Cummins Troubleshooting manual.
When monitoring switch positions using a Compulink TM or Pro-Link DDR the display would read: Coolant Level Sensor = Fault.

svcsubproc.para: The low coolant sensor (fluid level actuated switch) circuits are listed in the following chart.
INTERNATIONAL CIRCUIT BETWEEN C308 AND C307 (COOLANT SENSOR)
34B(5V) - 5 Volt supply from ECM To Sensor

This test procedure requires a VOM to check the International harness for opens, shorts to ground, or shorts to other circuits in the International harness. The low coolant sensor has complex circuits and a VOM should not be used to test the sensor as it may damage the circuits.
Refer to paragraph Radiator Coolant Level Sensor (307) for operation description of the low coolant sensor.

svcsubproc.title: Low Coolant Level Switch And Circuit Test
